item.title: Protest over seizure of Filipino fisherfolk's equipment won't affect Philippines' access to China vaccines
item.description: The Duterte administration is confident that the diplomatic protest it filed against China over the Chinese coastguard s seizure of Filipino fishermen s equipment won t get in the way of Manila s access to Chinese-made vaccines against COVID-19, the Palace said Friday.

item.title: NCRPO cop allegedly involved in robbery-extortion arrested --PNP
item.description: A police officer allegedly involved in robbery-extortion activity was arrested by operatives of the Philippine National Police-Integrity Monitoring Enforcement Group (PNP-IMEG) in front of a mall in Quezon City on Thursday.

item.title: Biden accepts Dem nomination, vows to end 'season of darkness'
item.description: US Democrat Joe Biden on Thursday accepted his party's nomination for president, telling the nation he will draw on the best of America and "overcome this season of darkness" if he is elected over rival Donald Trump.

item.title: Health workers among those to get first shots of COVID-19 vaccine under clinical trial, says expert
item.description: "'Doon po sa mga vaccine trials, ang mga uunahin po ay yung mga at-risk. So sino po ito? Mga healthcare workers, mga frontliners at saka mga tao na na-expose sa mga taong may COVID. So 'yun muna po ang uunahing isasama sa trial. Later on na 'yung mga iba," Philippine Foundation for Vaccination president Dr. Liza Gonzales said Friday.

item.title: House panel approves printing of Philippine map, EEZ, Sabah on passports
item.description: “The inclusion of the map on our travel document is a strong statement that we are asserting our sovereign rights over the West Philippine Sea and our EEZ,” Cagayan de Oro City Representative Rufus said.

item.title: LGUs should allow entry of returning residents amid COVID-19 --Palace
item.description: Local government units (LGUs) should allow entry to returning residents in their respective jurisdictions amid the COVID-19 pandemic, presidential spokesperson Harry Roque said Friday.

item.title: Beijing says residents can go mask-free as China COVID cases hit new lows
item.description: BEIJING - Health authorities in China's capital Beijing have removed a requirement for people to wear masks outdoors, further relaxing rules aimed at preventing the spread the novel coronavirus after the city reported 13 consecutive days without new cases.

item.title: No proposal to construct toll road on EDSA, DOTr clarifies
item.description: The Department of Transportation (DOTr) on Friday clarified that it is not proposing for the construction of toll road along EDSA.

item.title: Zubiri: PhilHealth 'roof leak' possibly deliberate to obstruct probe
item.description: Senate Majority Leader Juan Miguel Zubiri on Friday said he has a hunch that the "roof leak" which destroyed several documents and computers in PhilHealth Region 1's office may have been done to hamper ongoing investigations.

item.title: DILG welcomes Congress allotting budget for hiring of contact tracers
item.description: The Department of the Interior and Local Government (DILG) on Friday welcomed the move of Congress to appropriate P5 billion from the proposed Bayanihan to Recover as One Act or Bayanihan 2's P165.5 billion budget for the hiring of contact tracers.

item.title: COVID-19 vaccine just around the corner? No one applied for trials yet, says FDA exec
item.description: "Wala pa po kaming na-receive na clinical trial application," Dr. Jesusa Cirunay, director of FDA's Center for Drug Regulation and Research, said in an online forum. She explained that under a normal course, it would take about 45 to 60 days to approve an application for a clinical trial but it would be facilitated faster for COVID-19 vaccines.

item.title: Wearing of face shield inside commercial establishments now mandatory, says Palace
item.description: The wearing of face shields inside enclosed spaces, including malls, is now mandatory, presidential spokesperson Harry Roque said Friday.

item.title: Roque: PCCI welcome to join IATF as resource persons
item.description: Members of the Philippine Chamber of Commerce and Industry (PCCI) can serve as resource persons of the Inter-Agency Task Force (IATF) and therefore can participate in IATF meetings, presidential spokesperson Harry Roque Jr. said Friday.

item.title: Quarantine pass, IDs needed before entering QC establishments
item.description: The local government of Quezon City announced on Friday that residents need to present their quarantine passes or company IDs before entering any establishment in the city.

item.title: DOLE to handle P3-B aid for displaced tourism workers --Angara
item.description: The proposed P3 billion assistance to displaced tourism workers under the Bayanihan to Recover as One bill or Bayanihan 2 will be handled by the Department of Labor and Employment, Senator Sonny Angara said Friday.
